page.title: 12Schools
page.content: There are three primary schools in the district.Longlands School serves the Eastern end of the town. Mr Davies and his 11 teachers teach 279 children in a school purpose built in 1970.Between 9am and 3.30pm there is a full and interesting curriculum and after school and at lunch time there are lots of clubs including music, sports, dance and cookery.The western end of the town is served by a junior and infant school.At the infant school in Longslow Road,Mrs Grice and her staff teach 214 pupils between the ages of 5 and 7 in a building built in 1951.Each intake forms a class which stay together with the same teacher throughout their time at school.There is also a nursery unit attached which 120 3_5 year olds to attend for 5 half days a week. The children move on to the Junior School.
